name: Andaz Savannah

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three days at the AVIA and enjoyed every minute of it. The doormen always welcomed us like family when we would return after a long day of sight-seeing. The flavored water in the lobby was so refreshing. While we were there they had wonderful warm cider and delicious Christmas cookies.
reviews.title: Treated Like Family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully appointed and so quiet we thought we were the only people on the floor. We had a problem with adjusting the room temperature and within 20 minutes of calling the front desk for help, the engineer visited our room to tell us that the problem had been addressed.
reviews.title: Long weekend a pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Becky, the concierge, is priceless! We came to Savannah with an idea of what we wanted to do and Becky helped us to refine it. She gave us coupons for our ghost tour, discounts on the trolley tour (Olde Savannah Tours - the best!), and gently nudged us toward restaurants that she knew we would like.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel made Savannah trip outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was an incredible value. Freshly made crepes, waffes, omelets, fresh fruit, pastries, and the world's best grits. Miss Bee welcomes you and gives you the run down on what's available.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar staff makes the best Amaretto Sours we've ever had. And they remember just how you like them after only one visit.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been planning this mini vacay for my boyfriend and I for a month...I happened to be on another travel website and came across Avia and immediately fell in love with it...Upon arrival I was immediately greeted with a surprise...The requests that I made for my reservation could not be made upon check in so I was given an upgrade at no additional cost...Mr. Willy, who assisted us with our luggage was the coolest...The rooms were so elegant and cozy with one exception...The couch in my room was filthy and had an awful stench...I didn't report it bc my boyfriend and I were trying to figure out if it was the couch or was it a smell coming from outside bc the couch was right by the balcony doors...We later found out it was the couch bc my boyfriend left his coat on it overnight and when he retrieved it the next morning the stench was on the side of the coat that was touching the couch...I must comment about Ms. Dot(front desk) and Ms. V(restaurant staff)....They were such an inspiration to my boyfriend and I...There conversation was GREAT and they enhace the genuine spirit of your hotel...I will always come back to Avia as long as Ms. Dot and Ms. V will be there...
reviews.title: Amazing with small complaints....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel! The location is perfect, being right in the Historic District, two blocks from the Riverfront and City Market. The decor throughout the hotel is really nice--the lobby, restaurant, rooms, and hallways! They have free internet stations and wireless. They also have a really cool pool area. Even if you're not into swimming, this outdoor area on the 2nd floor of the hotel has a fire pit and comfy couches. The bathrooms were especially nice, with lots of counter space and good amenities. Plus, they do the little things, like open the front door every time you come and go. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Classy hotel right in the Historic District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose the Avia for a few reasons: the heated pool, the firepit and the signature services (as promoted on their web site). The Avia gets many, many things right, but not everything. Here’s what they got right:
reviews.title: Gorgeous Property, Mostly Hits But Some Misses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE DÉCOR: Gorgeous! Every space we saw was just gorgeous: the lobby, the lounge/bar, the dining area, the room, even the bathroom off the lobby. Loved it all!
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE BELL/DOOR STAFF/BAR STAFF & CONCIERGE: Amazing!They are knowledgeable, friendly and seem to genuinely enjoy chatting with you and making your stay super.
reviews.title: Fabulous, what all top hotels should strive for in customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I read all the reviews about customer service, I thought there was no way it was that great. But I was wrong. The customer service here was so incredibly amazing! From the bell guys, to the concierge, to the cleaning ladies. Everyone was eager to greeet you with a smile and help with any needs.
reviews.title: Incredible stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the perfect size w/ a full kitchen. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The robes were a nice tough. Great location too. Easy walk to Market street, Riverstreet and downtown.
reviews.title: true southern hospitalilty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this place to anyone!
reviews.title: Classy yet funky, Unique hotel gets an A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: By the way, we were trying to decide between this place and the Bohemian. When we visited the Bohemian to see what we missed, we were so happy w/ our decision. THere was a manager and four workers w/ us in the elevator. No one said hi, they just started complaining about work and other co-workers. VERY distasteful. No one ever said hello or offered to help. But the rooftop bar was nice.
reviews.title: Customer service at it's finest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: great stay...clean and great customer service. The only down side thin walls. Could hear a band playing across the street first night and our neighbors talking next door but everything else was perfect.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009
reviews.text: This was an awesome hotel experience. It was just steps from river stree, city market, and Paula Deens. It was a bit of a walk to some of the older historic homes. Loved It. I would say that everyone should stay here. Becky was great. She was nice and knew the city.
reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I just returned from our first trip to Savannah. We fell in love with the city. We stayed at the Avia based on recommendations from trip advisor. It exceeded all of our expectations. The staff was so wonderful. Very friendly and helpful. Be sure to stop by the front desk and visit Sam. She was such a delight. The beds were divine, and if there was not so much to see in Savannah you could have easily spent all day in the plush and comfortable room.
reviews.title: Avia=Divine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the renovation is complete on Ellis Square it will only add to the perfection of the hotel. It is the perfect spot, walking distance to everything. Only thing be ready to pay $20 a day for valet. We never needed our car though, we walked everywhere. It is a perfect location.
reviews.title: Fabulous Birthday Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, and is true to the Boutique style of hotels.
reviews.title: Great Service and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, dark romantic, the perfect place to take someone special. The absolute best thing about the hotel, is the staff. They did a great job of not only making us feel welcomed, but even better, they made us feel like family.
reviews.title: We went to visit Paula and Savannah...great choice.

description: Savannah, Georgia has been enhanced with a whole new hotel experience. With its artful décor, relaxed urban vibe and new South sophistication, Andaz Savannah offers a bold new sleek style and a sophisticated attitude to historic Savannah. Experience a fashionable urban escape across from Ellis Square shopping, nightlife and entertainment at Andaz Savannah.When you’re ready to get down to relaxation, our 151 ultra-modern guestrooms and suites are sanctuaries of calming repose. Each of our Savannah, Georgia hotel rooms feature sophisticated textures, a modern color palette, large windows, and surprising décor elements, resulting in a stylish haven of city-chic comfort. Delight in thoughtful in-room details such as king-sized beds cloaked in fine linens, walk-in showers and 42” flat screen televisions - details which make Andaz the most captivating of Savannah, Georgia hotels.For the very best in in Savannah dining, join us for dinner at 22 Square. Our very own "Market to Table" restaurant will delight our guests in the local flavor of the city. Our Chef has gone to great lengths to source out ingredients from local farmers and producers to ensure seasonality and freshness. Our bar at 22 Square takes you back to the "Art of the Cocktail" with hand-crafted cocktails made from fresh fruit juices,homemade syrups and tonics and artisanal liquors.
